content:
Product Link:  
https://DreamOmni2.com

Description  
DreamOmni2 is an innovative AI-powered virtual character platform, designed to provide users with personalized virtual character customization, supporting multilingual interaction.

Highlights:
- **Multilingual Support**: The platform supports major global languages, enabling smooth interaction with virtual characters.
- **Personalized Customization**: Users can customize their virtual character's appearance, personality, and voice according to their needs.
- **Highly Interactive**: The AI system adjusts the virtual character's responses in real-time based on the user's behavior and emotions.

### æç¤ºè¯ç¤ºä¾‹ï¼š
`Epic, Mythical: The Luminary Lion

Subject / Scene Settings
â€¢ Narrative tone: epic, majestic
â€¢ Subject type: mythical creature
â€¢ Material & Surface: lion of luminous filaments; ember-core iris; translucent fiber mane; light-refractive whiskers
â€¢ Key features: constellated mane; sparks shed on motion; whiskers as light cords
â€¢ Motion: prowl/tilt/shake/roar
â€¢ Scale: apex presence against cosmic void

Cast & Roles
â€¢ The Luminary â€“ focused, regal; apex predator

Environment
â€¢ Location: cosmic void; infinite black space
â€¢ Time: eternal night
â€¢ Weather/Atmosphere: haze 5%; floating particles
â€¢ Light quality: internal glow; directional accents
â€¢ Depth Layers: FG: floating sparks / MG: lion subject / BG: deep void

Lighting (Technical Multi-Source Setup)
â€¢ Key: internal amber glow 3200K; Fill: ambient void -2; Rim: 90Â° cool cyan 5600K; Kicker: under-jaw warm; Neg Fill: right side; haze 5%; volumetric beams

Camera (Movement & Composition)
â€¢ Shots: WS/MS/CU/ECU
â€¢ Composition: rule-of-thirds; left-third profile
â€¢ Movement: ONE move gimbal slow push forward
â€¢ Lens: anamorphic; shallow DoF; gentle focus racks
â€¢ Coverage: master + inserts; match-on-action

Grade (Color & Post)
â€¢ Palette: amber/ice-cyan/silver/graphite
â€¢ Curve: S-curve; lifted shadows
â€¢ Effects: bloom+halation; soft vignette; fine grain; slight CA; clean flares

Persist (Continuity Elements)
â€¢ Visual: same filament lion; amber core constant
â€¢ Light: directional rim; internal glow
â€¢ Direction: forward progression

Audio (BGM & SFX with Precise Timing)
â€¢ BGM: orchestral epic, 80 BPM, majestic
â€¢ SFX: energy hums, light crackles, deep roars
â€¢ Cues: 0.05s ambient hum; 2.0s eye-ignite spark; 4.0s mane surge whoosh; 8.8s deep roar
â€¢ Mix: duck BGM -3dB on roar

Dialogue (Timed & Concise)
â€¢ 0.0s [Narrator, deep, resonant]: "In the endless void..."
â€¢ 3.5s [Narrator]: "...a legend awakens."
â€¢ 7.0s [Narrator, building intensity]: "Behold... the Luminary."
â€¢ 9.5s [Narrator, powerful]: "Born of light, forged in eternity."

Structure (Editorial Rhythm & Pacing)
â€¢ Mode: montage; Duration: 10s; Tempo: 1.3
â€¢ Cut frequency: 0.4-0.6s rapid cuts
â€¢ Transition: match-on-action
â€¢ Key visuals: 1.0s WS prowl approach; 3.0s CU eye ignition; 5.0s MS mane surge; 8.5s ECU roar release
â€¢ End: freeze frame on roar pose`

title: ã€å·¥å…·æ¨èã€‘term.everythingï¼Œåœ¨ç»ˆç«¯é‡Œè¿è¡Œä»»ä½•GUIç¨‹åºï¼ŒåŒ…æ‹¬æµè§ˆå™¨ï¼Œæ¸¸æˆï¼Œç”šè‡³åœ¨ç»ˆç«¯é‡Œå¥—æ¡Œé¢
content:
é¡¹ç›®åœ°å€ï¼šhttps://github.com/mmulet/term.everything
ç¦»è°±ï¼Œåªèƒ½è¯´éå¸¸ç¦»è°±ï¼Œåˆéå¸¸æƒŠè‰³ã€‚
ç›´æ¥è´´å®˜æ–¹ä»“åº“çš„ä»‹ç»äº†ï¼Œå› ä¸ºæœ‰å¾ˆå¤šGIFåŠ¨å›¾ã€‚

> 
> ## Run every GUI app in the terminal!
> 
> ![warp_into_terminal0001-0195](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/mmulet/term.everything/main/resources/graphics/warp_in_2.gif)
> 
> ## Even over ssh!
> Behold as I play a [video game in a font](https://github.com/mmulet/font-game-engine) in a web browser in a terminal transmitted over ssh (with one hand tied behind my back)!
> 
> ![ssh_example](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/mmulet/term.everything/main/resources/graphics/ssh_example.gif)
> 
> ### Read about how it works!
> Check out [HowIDidIt.md](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/mmulet/term.everything/main/resources/HowIDidIt.md)
> 
> ## More Examples
> The quality of the window is limited to the number of rows and columns in your
> terminal. If you increase the resolution (ctrl - in alacritty, check your
> terminal) the quality will go up, (but performance may go down).
> 
> Here I open up the Wing It! movie, and increase the quality until I get both
> a good frame rate and resolution:
> 
> ![increase resolution](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/mmulet/term.everything/main/resources/graphics/show_increase_res.gif)
> 
> ----------------
> 
> If your terminal supports images (like [kitty](https://sw.kovidgoyal.net/kitty/)
> or [iterm2](https://iterm2.com/)) you can render windows at full resolution
> (performance may degrade).
> 
> In this example, on my mac, I open iTerm2 ssh into ubuntu and open firefox
> at full resolution:
> 
> ![full_resultion](resources/graphics/full_resultion.gif)
> 
> ------------
> 
> I feel like every single day I hear about another terminal file viewer. I say, stop making terminal file viewers because you can just use the file viewer you already have! In your terminal!
> 
> ![file_manager](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/mmulet/term.everything/main/resources/graphics/file_manager.gif)
> 
> -------------
> 
> Terminal in a terminal in a terminal in a terminal in a terminal.... it's terminals all the way down.
> ![terminal_in_terminal](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/mmulet/term.everything/main/resources/graphics/terminal_in_terminal.gif)
> 
> -------------
> With only a small amount hacking, it can run Doom (shareware episode)!
> 
> ![Doom](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/mmulet/term.everything/main/resources/graphics/doom.gif)
> ------
> Run an entire Desktop in your terminal!
> [@ismail-yilmaz](https://github.com/ismail-yilmaz) is running Firefox, on [KDE Neon](https://neon.kde.org) in a [VM](https://gitlab.gnome.org/GNOME/gnome-boxes) on [Bobcat](https://github.com/ismail-yilmaz/Bobcat)
> ![Desktop in VM](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/mmulet/term.everything/main/resources/graphics/desktop_in_vm.gif)
